website_summaries.verdict: A compact weather radio with a special tornado only alert button for people who live in regions that are prone to tornados.
pros: The color-coded system lets you immediately know if the alert is an advisory, a watch, or a warning
The LCD displays scrolling text alerts and the unit has a built-in flashlight and features an ergonomic, non-slip grip
cons: There is no squelch control on this model so it can be quite noisy between alerts

customer_reviews.title: Poor reception, constant atmospheric noise
customer_reviews.text: Have 2 other different brands weather radios that work fine our rural location. Bought this one for the "tornado only" alert feature. Constant background static when on, no squelch control to make it quite when not receiving..and it does not even receive our local weather frequency unless you drive it up onto a nearby hill. All our other weather radio brands receive our local Noaa channel inside the home just fine. Constant static noise, no reception, very short antenna, no external antenna plug option, not sure what this one was designed/intended for. Gonna give it to someone I hope the weather will get.
customer_reviews.author: The May;s, Red Bluff Tx

customer_reviews.title: Bad software, FIPS code erased on power off and back on
customer_reviews.text: Poor software. The radio works fairly well on the NOAA channels. But to my surprise after entering four FIPS codes for my surrounding counties, they all disappeared when turned the radio off and back on again later! Kind of defeats the purpose of this feature. .
customer_reviews.author: Dennylxs

customer_reviews.title: Check location before ordering.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a while, and am not pleased with it. It could also be because of where I live, a rural community, but have fiddled with it, and just has poor reception. If you live out in the country, I do NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mcclain

customer_reviews.title: Built well, not a cheap model
customer_reviews.text: seems built very well, I've had other portable radios where I could program in the warnings to only activate for certain counties, I'm not seeing that as an option on here, but it's a great backup weather radio when I'm working in my garage and something bad is on its way. And I don't think anyone will have an issue hearing the alert go off when that volume is cranked. takes a lot to start on me, but I almost had a heart attack the first time I heard the weather radio go off. Okay, not that bad, but you get the picture!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Ruden

customer_reviews.title: I Am Blown Away
customer_reviews.text: When disaster is looming, or not, I'll know about it. To this point this is the best weather radio I have owned. I bought it specifically for tornado season which is severely annoying when we are in that season. All the other weather radios go off with all events including those which are hundreds of miles away. Hopefully, and I believe its the case, this one will be more geographically specific ... though I'm not sure how it will accomplish that. It is compact and has a bunch of nice features.
customer_reviews.author: Another Mike

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very seldom, do I ever post disappointing reviews. Unfortunately, the photo of this does NOT depict the actual item. The actual item is like a plastic toy for a kid. Very disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: E.M.C

customer_reviews.title: Buy a Midland radio.  This thing is junk.  Alerts do not work.
customer_reviews.text: Alerts do not work. Buy any weather radio made by Midland if you value your life. Did a test today. Midland alerted me and this radio just sat there.
customer_reviews.author: Joe's Pizza

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, but full of static
customer_reviews.text: It's small and lightweight, which is good for carrying it away from home, or stowing in a purse on a stormy day, just in case. It can run on batteries or electricity. However, it's very staticy and a little difficult to hear clearly. I've tried it in many different spots with the same results.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend their 810-805
customer_reviews.text: They make may great products. I like the Tornado warning feature. For field and travel, I will use their 810-805.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for weather
customer_reviews.text: Work great pick up am/FM radio good and tell you if you got severe weather coming on the weather radio.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Small but effective. Does it’s job well. I leave it plugged up on alert mode and have not been disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Fury7849

customer_reviews.title: This is clever, but lack RF receiving ability
customer_reviews.text: I disappointed that apparently you have to be closer to Weather radio. I am 20-30 miles and that is too far.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian L. Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: The other warnings are nice, I suppose
customer_reviews.text: Only unit I've found that has a tornado-only option. The other warnings are nice, I suppose, but I live in Kansas and waking up for every high wind warning or flash flood watch isn't very funny.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Not supposed to be a toy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I live within 20 miles of the tower and with all the static (no Squelch) it’s almost impossible to hear the broadcast. Also it looks and feels like a toy, not something that could possibly save lives, very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will not pick up any weather at all
customer_reviews.text: I live in VT and have had weather radios that receice. This one is hit or miss whether or not it will receive a broadcast and when it does its mostly static.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Holms

customer_reviews.title: i like
customer_reviews.text: for the price its worth it use it to check my noaa weather daily
customer_reviews.author: jason huckelbery

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this radio
customer_reviews.text: Product did not work day one right out of the box. Tried batteries as well as wall power. Numbers missing sections on screen so could not read any text or numbers.
customer_reviews.author: T/hawaii

customer_reviews.title: Love the radio but lacks sturdy components.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound but cumbersome to workout instructions-antenna could be much sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: ghostdiving

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Like the portable tech, I can move it from room to room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my Dad and he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: But I was disappointed in the very cheap plastic housing of the radio
customer_reviews.text: The La Crosse weather radio has all the bells and whistles I was looking for in a portable radio. But I was disappointed in the very cheap plastic housing of the radio. I feel if it is dropped its game over. The FM stations come in ok. The AM and NOAA stations have a lot of static. I paid about fifty dollar for this radio which is twenty dollars to much in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: SETH THOMAS

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this product I like the color and the weather reports...
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT A. KANTER

customer_reviews.title: Great price for great device
customer_reviews.text: Worked great last night during the storm outbreak. Now that I'm back in OK I'm glad I have this
customer_reviews.author: Gary Halstead

customer_reviews.title: reception is not that good, regardless if you near city limits or outside ...
customer_reviews.text: reception is not that good , regardless if you near city limits or outside the limits. Contacted the company because the first one really did not pick up anything without a lot of static. They sent me one free of charge and its performance was just a little bit better. I am in the Atlanta GA area. I bought the unit because my co-worker had an older model which I was highly impressed with. The newer one just is not cutting it. However for the price its OK.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin A. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Largely non-functional. Poor reception. inadequate controls, and a big waste of money for us. Photogenically attractive but otherwise essentially worthless. I should have boUght MIDLAND. A rating of 1 is too high.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Byrd

customer_reviews.title: Over priced
customer_reviews.text: This is constructed like a very cheap toy. It does work but unhappy with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Kurrasch

customer_reviews.title: Thought other reviews were wrong
customer_reviews.text: I thought the reviews were wrong. They were right on target. Poor design. Radio in useless. I can see the transmission tower of a 50,000 watt radio station (AM 1170) from my house and still get bad reception from this device. Save the trouble, buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Prettyman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: A must have item, stay abreast of weather even when power is out. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: John T.

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable for a hurricane, poor battery life, need to find new brand
customer_reviews.text: This is my second lacrosse radio. The first one, the crank broke on the first use. The battery life was terrible. What I believed to be faulty. So they sent me this one as a replacement. Turns out they just make bad radios, not meant for hurricanes or storms. The radio is very static ,even on noaa stations. It eats through batteries, my first 8 hrs in the storm, the battery got low and then the stations just started to become garbled. Both radios were unreliable for a storm that is longer than 4 hrs, time to find a new brand.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Winters

customer_reviews.title: lacross  techinology s 830101 noaa weather
customer_reviews.text: my area is 162450 i set it there and turn it off and goes back to 162400 .it full od static i like my old midland better than this my 162 450 is for my area morris ill pontiac and gibson city but turn of is goe to 162400 for plano ect . it dum if i leave it one 162.450 and hit the armed buttion for tornoda or all weather dont hold down power buttion it screw up i,m very disapointed with it
customer_reviews.author: Jason L. Ryder

customer_reviews.title: Great choice!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this radio several years ago. I live in tornado alley and it has done a great job of keeping us informed. It does have static in it but if you raise the antenna it clears up. I have never lost my locations after turning it off. Even over the winter, come spring it remembers my locations. Has good reception even while we’re In the underground storm shelter. Battery life has been long for our unit but we make a habit of changing them every spring prior to tornado season. Bought a second unit for my daughter who lives in this area also.
customer_reviews.author: D. Krog

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, Chinese made = poorly manufactured product. Get a better product.
customer_reviews.text: This model has some promising features at a good price.........unfortunately the cheap price equals a cheaply made product. The antenna is not mounted well and the radio can't get a clear signal as a result. The mounting screw finally let loose during a recent storm event rendering the device useless during a severe weather outbreak. I was able to unscrew the back to try and remount the antenna only to find that the screw's base was stripped at the factory and wouldn't hold. Throwing this one in the trash and getting a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Sloan Ozanne

product_meta.title: La Crosse Technology S83301-1 NOAA Weather Radio with Tornado ALERTS
product_meta.description: Receive up-to-the-minute weather updates. This convenient handheld am/FM weather radio receives seven different NOAA weather band channels. Armed LED light indicates setting to tornado only alerts to filter out unwanted alerts when you sleep. No programming required. Blue LCD backlight illuminates in standby mode and changes to red during NOAA alerts. Dual color LCD also features scrolling alert text. 3 LED alert lights change with warnings: ADVISORY/watch/Warning. It also functions as a standard am/FM radio for recreational use. The integrated LED flashlight is helpful during power failures or outdoor activities. Ergonomic, rugged design with non-slip grip for perfect handheld use.
feature_bullets: One button selection: TORNADO only alerts or all alerts
LCD changes from blue to red during weather alerts; 3 LED alert lights: advisory/watch/Warning
USA IC chip for high-quality digital audio radio optimum am/FM reception

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars120 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
